text.p: Although Python provides a built-in function for computing the length of a string, we can write our own.
Write an iterative function, lenIter, which computes the length of an input argument (a string), by counting up the number of characters in the string.

codeparam.initial_display:
def lenIter(aStr): ''' aStr: a string
returns: int, the length of aStr ''' # Your code here
codeparam.answer_display:
def lenIter(aStr): ''' aStr: a string
returns: int, the length of aStr ''' # Initialize a variable to hold our final count count = 0
# Iterate over each character in the string, counting each one for char in aStr: count += 1 return count
